question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What league did Shack Scott play in in 2025?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

**Breaking News: Shack Scott Takes the Court in NCAA Division I Men's Basketball**

In a thrilling development for college basketball enthusiasts, Shack Scott, a talented young player, has been confirmed to be participating in the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league. This exciting news has sent ripples of excitement throughout the sports community, with fans and analysts alike eagerly anticipating Scott's performances on the court. According to credible sources, Scott suited up for Wagner College during the 2017-2018 season, solidifying his position as a key player in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. This elite league, comprising the top-tier colleges and universities in the United States, is renowned for its high level of competition and rich history of producing talented athletes. "We're thrilled to have Shack Scott on our team," said Bashir Mason, Head Coach of Wagner College's men's basketball team. "His skills and dedication to the sport are undeniable, and we're confident he'll make a significant impact in the NCAA Division I league." Data from the NCAA reveals that Wagner College, a private liberal arts college located in Staten Island, New York, has a strong reputation in the league, with a winning percentage of .542 in the 2017-2018 season. Scott's participation in the team undoubtedly contributed to this success, showcasing his abilities as a formidable player in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. "Shack Scott's presence on the court is a testament to the league's commitment to fostering talented athletes," said Dan Gavitt, NCAA Senior Vice President of Basketball. "We're proud to have him representing the NCAA Division I men's basketball league, and we look forward to seeing his continued growth and success." With Scott's impressive skills and the NCAA Division I men's basketball league's rich history of producing top-notch athletes, fans can expect an electrifying season ahead. Stay tuned for more updates on Shack Scott's journey in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league.
content.source_2:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Former College Basketball Star Shack Scott Finds New Success in Belarusian Football

Minsk, Belarus - In a surprising career shift, former college basketball player Shack Scott has made a name for himself in the Belarusian Second League, a professional football league in Eastern Europe. Scott, who played for Wagner College from 2017 to 2018, traded in his basketball sneakers for football cleats and has been dominating the pitch since August 2034. In an exclusive interview with our correspondent, Scott revealed that he had always had a passion for football, but never had the opportunity to pursue it seriously until after his college basketball career. "I was always fascinated by the game, but I never thought I'd have the chance to play at a professional level," Scott said. "When the opportunity arose to join the Belarusian Second League, I jumped at it." Scott's decision has paid off, as he has become a fan favorite in the league. His impressive skills on the pitch have earned him a reputation as a formidable opponent, and his team, FC Baranovichi, has seen a significant improvement in their standings since his arrival. According to league statistics, Scott has scored 23 goals in 50 appearances, making him one of the top scorers in the league. His impressive performance has also caught the attention of national team scouts, and there is speculation that he may be called up to the Belarusian national team in the near future. When asked about his experience playing in the Belarusian Second League, Scott praised the league's competitiveness and the warm welcome he has received from fans and teammates alike. "The level of play is incredibly high, and I've had to work hard to adapt to the European style of football," Scott said. "But the fans have been amazing, and my teammates have been very supportive. It's been a great experience so far." Scott's success in the Belarusian Second League has also sparked interest from other football leagues around the world. While he has not ruled out the possibility of playing in other leagues in the future, Scott is committed to seeing out his contract with FC Baranovichi, which runs until December 2041.
